thread.title: Now Dominos caught using supermarket CHICKEN: Staff spotted buying Aldi wings and coleslaw
thread.title_full: Now Dominos caught using supermarket CHICKEN: Staff spotted buying Aldi wings and coleslaw

author: Nick Reilly
title: Now Dominos caught using supermarket CHICKEN: Staff spotted buying Aldi wings and coleslaw
text: Share View photos The Domino’s worker was seen filling his trolley at an Aldi store in Dartford, Kent (Picture: Caters) More A stunned shopper has complained to Domino’s after she spotted a ‘sheepish’ member of staff filling a shopping trolley with hundreds of raw chicken wings and coleslaw from ALDI. Caroline Foskett, 31, was shopping in the Aldi branch in Dartford, Kent, on Friday February 10, when she spotted the man ‘awkwardly’ wandering the aisles with a trolley. Wearing what appeared to be a Domino’s coat and cap, the man was reportedly waiting for Aldi staff to restock the freezer after he had emptied it of chicken wings and dippers. It comes only a week after a Domino’s worker was spotted buying cheap potato wedges at an Asda store, which were later sold to customers at a huge mark-up of £3.99 a portion. Caroline, a teacher from London, claims that the man already had six or seven tubs of coleslaw, eight or nine boxes of chicken strips, and the same amount in chicken wings. The mum-of-two sent the image to Domino’s after noticing that the store had hit the headlines only a week previously – when staff were spotted bulk buying wedges in Asda. View photos The Domino’s worker was spotted at a branch of Aldi in Dartford, Kent (Picture: Caters) More ‘No-one needs that much chicken for themselves’, Caroline said. ‘We used to get pizzas on the weekend because my husband works then and we’d spend well over £20, but now I’m not so sure. ‘He certainly looked a bit sheepish, like he was trying to be very discreet but if he was going to do that he could at least take off his uniform. ‘He had about eight or nine boxes of chicken strips and a similar amount of legs.’ View photos The Domino’s worker was seen filling his trolley at a branch in Dartford, Kent. (Picture: Caters) More Domino’s hit the headlines last week after they admitted to buying cheap supermarket wedges from Asda for £1 a bag before selling them to customers. The pizza giant claimed that the surplus stock was needed after a ‘big sporting weekend’ caused some stores to run out of products.
